item.title: M2 announces shoot ’em up Night Striker GEAR
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2024/11/m2-announces-shoot-em-up-night-striker-gear

The TAITO shoot 'em up returns as a new title.

M2 has announced Night Striker GEAR, a new entry following TAITO‘s 1989-released 3D shoot ’em up Night Striker. Platforms and a release date were not announced.

“While keeping textures achieved via scaling effects in tact, we are creating a beautiful new world in pixel art,” reads the announcement. “With the addition of the new ‘GEAR System,’ we’re delivering exhilarating gameplay with simple controls. Please look forward to further information, which will be announced by M2 at a later date.”

In related news, publisher TAITO and developer M2 also announced Operation Night Strikers, a collection including Night Striker and rail shooter Operation Wolf for PC. Read more here.

item.title: TAITO and M2 announce Operation Night Strikers for PC – Operation Wolf and Night Strikers collection
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2024/11/taito-and-m2-announce-operation-night-strikers-for-pc-operation-wolf-and-night-strikers-collection

  • PC

Developed by M2 and published by TAITO.

Publisher TAITO and developer M2 have announced Operation Night Strikers, a collection including the 1987-released rail shooter Operation Wolf and the 1989-released 3D shoot ’em up Night Striker. It will launch for PC via Steam in 2025.

Operation Night Strikers will be compatible with standard PC game controllers, as well as the Intelligent Controller Cyber ​​Stick due ot on December 19 in Japan. Operation Wolf can also be played with a mouse.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

Operation Wolf and Night Striker, two milestones of the 80s arcade movement in one action-packed compilation! Relieve all the high-speed arcade thrills and explosive spills!

Title Lineup

  • Operation Wolf
  • Night Striker

Operation Wolf

Using only a machine gun and rocket-propelled grenades, you alone must infiltrate enemy territory, secure the hostages, then get them safely to the extraction point! The mission code is Operation Wolf.

Night Striker

Become a member of the United Nations Special Action Force, a.k.a. Night Striker, and destroy the enemy terrorist organization with in your high-speed combat hovercraft: Intergray!

Two faithful ports, complete with various gadgets, replay functions, and other useful features to enhance the originals!

Key Features

  • Apply filters to simulate actual arcade monitors.
  • New gadgets to display various useful information.
  • Includes multiple arcade versions of each title.
  • Save / load anytime during play.
  • Upload your own play data, or download and view top ranking players’ data.
  • Compatible with the Cyber Stick intelligent controller.

In related news, M2 also announced Night Striker GEAR, a new entry in the Night Strikers series currently in development. Read more here.

View the first screenshots at the gallery.

item.title: Stellar Blade coming to PC in 2025
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2024/11/stellar-blade-coming-to-pc-in-2025

  • PC
  • PS5

PlayStation 5 sales have remained steady even after the initial surge.

SHIFT UP expects to release a PC version of Stellar Blade in 2025, the company said in its Q3 2024 earnings report Q&A.

“We’re aiming for a 2025 release,” SHIFT UP said in response to a question about when a PC version of Stellar Blade will release. “Given recent trends like Steam’s growing presence in the AAA games market and the global success of Black Myth: Wukong, we are expecting the PC version to perform even better than the console version.”

As for the PlayStation 5 version, which launched on April 26 and is receiving its latest update and a NieR: Automata crossover downloadable content on November 20, SHIFT UP said that “sales have remained steady even as the initial surge has calmed.”

In other news, SHIFT UP said that it is considering sharing further information on Project Witches, its cross-platform project planned for release in 2027 or later, sometime in the first half of 2025.
